personalInfo.clubAffl: Pleasant Valley CC (Little Rock, Arkansas); The Alotian Club (Little Rock, Arkansas)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Web.com Tour Past Champion/5-10 Years (2011-2006)
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Did not make any appearances on the Web.com Tour.

2013: Played in 20 Web.com Tour events, making the cut in 10. Best outing was a T11 at the Pacific Rubiales Colombia Championship in March, where he opened with 66 and closed with a 67. Finished 104th on the money list.

2012: Made 24 starts on the Web.com Tour and had two top-10 finishes...Was T7 at the Utah Championship, closing with 65 Sunday...Also was T10 at the Winn-Dixie Jacksonville Open after being one stroke off the lead through 36 holes at TPC Sawgrass. 

2011: Opened the Web.com Tour year with four consecutive top-20 finishes, including a season-best T13 in the initial stop at the Panama Claro Championship. Made the cut in 12 of 23 starts. 

2010: Played in 22 Web.com Tour events, making 10 cuts. His top finish came at The Rex Hospital Open. Also had four rounds in the 60s to T27 at the Ford Wayne Gretzky Classic Presented by Samsung. 

2009: Made the cut in 11 of 24 starts on the Web.com Tour. Best efforts of the season were a pair of T5 finishes at the Web.com Tour Players Cup and the Northeast Pennsylvania Classic. 

2008: Made the cut in five of 22 starts on the PGA TOUR, with his best finish a T36 at the Mayakoba Golf Classic.

2007: Made the cut in 20 of 27 starts on the Web.com Tour, including 11 top-25 finishes. Finished the year No. 11 on the money list, with $271,950. Posted only one top-10 finish in his first 16 starts—a T6 at the South Georgia Classic—but made the cut in 11 of his last 12 starts, including five top-10s and seven top-25s. Lost in a playoff to Brad Adamonis at the WNB Golf Classic followed by his first career win, at the Chattanooga Classic. Finished at 17-under 271, one stroke in front of David McKenzie in Tennessee, collecting $85,500. The two-week span helped him move from No. 34 to No. 11 on the money list, guaranteeing a return trip to the PGA TOUR in 2008. 

2006: Was back on the PGA TOUR for the first time since 1996 after finishing T13 at the 2005 Qualifying Tournament. Made it through all three stages. Had just one top-10 finish, a T9 at the Frys.com Open. 

2005: Played Gateway and Tight Lies Tours. Enjoyed six wins on Tight Lies Tour and was the Player of the Year in 2004. 

2003: Played on the Gateway and Tight Lies Tours. 

2000: Played on the Sunshine and Tight Lies Tours. 

1998: Spent the season on the Web.com Tour, posting a best finish of T3 at the St. Louis Golf Classic. 

1997: Spent season on the Web.com Tour, where he finished 46th on money list. Best performance was a third-place showing at the 1997 Laurel Creek Classic. 

1996: During the season, made eight of 23 cuts with best finishes of T33 at the Deposit Guaranty Golf Classic and Buick Open. Earned initial TOUR card after finishing T37 at 1995 Qualifying Tournament. 

1995: Played the Sunshine Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was an All-American at Wake Forest and won the 1994 Jerry Pate Invitational at Shoal Creek.
tourBios.personal: Had his first golf lesson from Arnold Palmer when he was age 2...His uncle is Lanny Wadkins...If he weren't a golfer, he would be in a band...Never travels without his iPhone, iPad and a book...Twitter account is @rwhittaker71...Not many people know he loves watching Food Network...His wife owns a store called Mrs. Polka Dot...enjoys cooking, reading and yard work...Always carries quarters from the 1960s in his pocket...Lists "Gladiator" as his favorite movie and the New York Yankees as his favorite professional team...Would love to trade places for a day with a Top Gun fighter pilot...Dream foursome would include Elvis Presley, Ben Hogan, Holly Sonders...Favorite quote "Winners never quit" from Vince Lombardi.

tourBios.personal: Had his first golf lesson from Arnold Palmer when he was age 2...His uncle is Lanny Wadkins...If he weren't a golfer, he would be in a band...Never travels without his iPhone, iPad and a book...Twitter account is @RWhittaker71...Not many people know he loves watching Food Network...His wife owns a store called Mrs. Polka Dot.
tourBios.otherInfo: Made the cut in 20 of 27 starts on the 2007 Nationwide Tour, including 11 top-25 finishes. Finished the year No. 11 on the money list, with $271,950. Posted only one top-10 finish, a T6 at the South Georgia Classic, in his first 16 starts, but made the cut in 11 of his last 12 starts, including five top-10s and seven top-25s. Lost in a playoff to Brad Adamonis at the WNB Golf Classic, followed by his first career win at the Chattanooga Classic. Finished at 17-under 271 and one stroke in front of David McKenzie in Chattanooga, collecting $85,500. The two-week span helped him move from No. 34 to No. 11 on the money list, guaranteeing a return trip to the PGA TOUR in 2008. Was back on the PGA TOUR in 2006 for the first time since 1996 after finishing T13 at the 2005 Qualifying Tournament. Made it through all three stages. Had just one top-10 finish in 2006, a T9 at the Frys.com Open. During the 1996 season, made eight of 23 cuts with best finishes of T33 at the Deposit Guaranty Golf Classic and Buick Open. Earned initial TOUR card after finishing T37 at 1995 Qualifying Tournament. Spent 1997 and 1998 seasons on the Nationwide Tour, where he finished 46th on money list in 1997. Best finishes included a third at the 1997 Laurel Creek Classic and a T3 at the 1998 St. Louis Golf Classic. Played Sunshine Tour in 1995 and 2000, Gateway Tour in 2003 and 2005 and Tight Lies Tour in 2000 and 2003-05. Six wins on Tight Lies Tour and was the Player of the Year in 2004. Had his first golf lesson from Arnold Palmer when he was age 2. His uncle is Lanny Wadkins.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was 1st in 2007 at the Chattanooga Classic Presented by Black Creek.
